alert.note: Alert for Clay; Lowndes; Oktibbeha (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 01 at 6:50PM CDT until September 01 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Clay County in northeastern Mississippi... Lowndes County in northeastern Mississippi... Oktibbeha County in northeastern Mississippi... * Until 945 PM CDT. * At 650 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Starkville, Columbus, West Point, Maben, Crawford, Artesia, Longview, Sturgis, Sessums, Tibbee, Muldrow, Oktoc, Bent Oak, Waverly, Craig Springs, Columbus AFB and Kolola Springs. This includes the following streams and drainages... Catalpa Creek, Chinchahoma Creek, Motley Slough, Gilmer Creek, Dry Branch, Golden Horn Creek, Shotbag Creek, Little Creek, Sun Creek, McCrary Creek, Dry Creek, Luxapallila Creek, Moore Creek, Sand Creek, Buttahatchee River, Fallah, Bogue, Hollis Creek, Mayo Slough, Town Creek, Red Bud Creek, Skinner Creek, Magby Creek, Trim Cane Creek, Browning Creek, McGee Creek, Pigeon Roost Creek, Tobacco Juice Creek, Noxubee River, James Creek, Rocky Bottom Creek, Ellis Creek, By-Wy Creek, Howard Creek, Kincaide Creek, North Branch Magowah Creek, South Branch Magowah Creek, Line Creek, Magowah Creek, Big Creek, Cedar Creek, Talking Warrior Creek, Jackson Branch, Shaw Creek, Tombigbee River, Bearfoot Branch, Cane Creek, Bonny Slough, Oak Slush Creek, Vernon Branch, Josey Creek and Black Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
